intro: Volvulus hederaceus, commonly known as the common groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with alternate, heart-shaped leaves that are hairy and have a rough texture. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in the spring, followed by the production of small, oval-shaped seeds. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
